newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila wants to become East Asia's financial hub.
newsitem.headline: Manila wants to become East Asia's financial hub.

text.p: The Philippines is initiating several measures which will transform the country into a major financial centre in east Asia, a senior official said on Wednesday.

"The prospect of being a world financial centre has never been more encouraging," Raphael Lotilla, deputy director general of the National Economic and Development Authority (NEDA), told a group of bankers.
NEDA is the economic policy and planning agency of the country.
Lotilla said the government had upgraded systems for stocks and government securities trading, allowing for scripless trading and faster clearing.
The government is also revising laws to allow full foreign ownership in investment firms, mutual funds and pension funds to encourage more participants in the market, he added.
A derivatives market is also being planned to trade futures including the stock index.
